article:
Several 'European Union member states' have 'special territories' which, for
historical, geographical, or political reasons, enjoy special status within or
outside of the European Union. These statuses range from no or limited
derogation from EU policies, limited inclusion in EU policies, or none at all.
Most of the territories which are outside the EU nonetheless have a special
relationship with the EU.
categories: Foreign relations of the European Union
Special territories of the European Union|*
